overview:
CTO, EDISON Software Development Centre

In his childhood Anthony took a keen interest in electrical engineering and this later led to computer programming. Software development then became his main area of activity. When he was still at school, Anthony and his friend developed a program, which won first prize at a youth science conference. This was quite an achievement as Anthony did not even have a computer at home.

Anthony graduated from Kemerovo State University as a qualified “Mathematician, Systems Programmer”. He joined EDISON Software Development Centre practically straight from university. Colleagues see Anthony as an example of how a programmer can rise to chief technical officer in a relatively short time thanks to diligence and commitment. He is also a natural teacher and enjoys helping other members of staff learn and develop their skills.

Anthony’s professional interests include: cryptography, data protection, and the construction of complex mathematical algorithms. In his free time he does yoga and plays volleyball.

Anthony takes a philosophical view of software development. He says creating software is like making a play: write a scenario, allocate roles to the different actors, and then at the crucial moment when the application is launched everything goes smoothly and according to plan. As a student, Anthony used to direct theatrical performances so this seems an appropriate parallel to draw.
